narrative.narrative: Kyrgyzstan Airlines was the flag carrier of the country with the same name in central Asia from 1993-2005 when it was taken over by Altyn Air and then the merged airline became Air Kyrgyzstan. It was based at Manas airport in Bishkek. It operated to 6 airports in Russia, 3 domestic outside of Bishkek, Delhi,India, Urumqi,China, Tajikistan, Karachi,Pakistan Istanbul,Turkey, and Birmingham,England. At the end they had five An-28's, two Il-76TD's,two Tu-154M's,two Tu-134A's,two Yak-40's,an An-26 and an Airbus 320.
